ground_truth: The two of them step out into a corridor, the walls and floor lined with shiny black tiles. They see Fudge talking to Lucius Malfoy outside the courtroom. Harry nods nervously as the jurors exchange glances. He approaches Fudge while Dumbledore sighs and addresses the members of the jury. Some jurors murmur to each other as Fudge raises his hand. With a sickly smile, the Undersecretary raises hers, and others follow suit. Many more jurors raise their hands; Mrs. Figg raises hers, then makes to scratch her ear, and Amelia Bones raises her hand. Harry jumps to his feet, but Dumbledore has gone. At Kings Cross Station, Moody and Nymphadora Tonks lead Harry and the Weasley family across a footbridge, while a large black dog hesitates beside Harry. The huge dog trots into a waiting room and turns into a man, and Harry runs in after him. In a group photograph of 20 people, Harry's parents stand beside Sirius, and Harry hands the photograph back to Sirius. Harry walks along the platform crowded with Hogwarts' students and their families, seeing the tall, gaunt figure of Voldemort facing him. The Dark Lord twists and flexes his neck. On the train, Harry sits in a corner of the carriage, shifting uneasily and twisting his neck, while Hermione sits beside him and glances at Ron. As evening falls, the Hogwarts Express speeds along the coast, a plume of white smoke streaming from the funnel. Hogwarts School sits beside a river running down to the sea. They emerge from the train as Draco Malfoy struts along the platform. Ron holds Harry back, but Harry shakes Ron off. Outside the station, four girls sit in a horseless carriage, one of them being Cho, a pretty Oriental girl who smiles at Harry. The carriage pulls away, and Harry stares after it. As they wait for another carriage, Neville joins them, carrying a cactus. Harry turns and sees a strange creature behind him; it has a head like a horse and stretches its long leathery neck. Puzzled, Harry inspects the animal more closely. In the carriage behind it, a girl with long blond hair sits reading a magazine upside down. They all climb in, and Hermione shifts uncomfortably as they all look confused. In the great hall, Luna and the other students tuck into a luscious assortment of puddings, while Harry has an empty space beside him and looks over at Seamus, who pointedly ignores him. He stops as Professor Umbridge, the former Undersecretary, rises smiling primly. She's a small woman in a sugar-pink suit with matching accessories, and the twins are not convinced as she beams at Dumbledore. Filch applauds enthusiastically. Harry walks into the Gryffindor common room, and everyone turns to look at him, while Ron glares around the common room then follows Harry upstairs.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: The pair of them tread out into a hallway, the partitions and ground lined with glossy ebony tiles. They perceive Fudge speaking to Lucius Malfoy outside the courtroom. Harry inclines nervously as the jurors swap looks. He nears Fudge while Dumbledore exhales and addresses the members of the jury. Some jurors mutter to each other as Fudge lifts his hand. With a nauseating grin, the Undersecretary elevates hers, and others do likewise. Many more jurors elevate their hands; Mrs. Figg elevates hers, then makes to scratch her ear, and Amelia Bones elevates her hand. Harry leaps to his feet, but Dumbledore has departed. At Kings Cross Station, Moody and Nymphadora Tonks guide Harry and the Weasley kin across a footbridge, while a substantial ebony canine hesitates beside Harry. The colossal dog trots into a waiting room and transforms into a man, and Harry rushes in after him. In a group photograph of 20 individuals, Harry's progenitors stand beside Sirius, and Harry hands the photograph back to Sirius. Harry walks along the platform crowded with Hogwarts' students and their kin, perceiving the towering, cadaverous figure of Voldemort confronting him. The Dark Lord contorts and flexes his neck. On the train, Harry rests in a corner of the compartment, shifting uncomfortably and contorting his neck, while Hermione sits beside him and glances at Ron. As dusk descends, the Hogwarts Express races along the coast, a plume of white smoke streaming from the funnel. Hogwarts School sits beside a river coursing down to the sea. They emerge from the train as Draco Malfoy struts along the platform. Ron restrains Harry back, but Harry shakes Ron off. Outside the station, four girls sit in a horseless carriage, one of them being Cho, a pretty Oriental girl who smiles at Harry. The carriage pulls away, and Harry gazes after it. As they wait for another carriage, Neville joins them, carrying a cactus. Harry turns and sees a peculiar being behind him; it has a head like a horse and extends its long leathery neck. Puzzled, Harry observes the creature more closely. In the carriage behind it, a girl with long blond hair sits perusing a magazine upside down. They all climb in, and Hermione shifts uncomfortably as they all appear bewildered. In the great hall, Luna and the other students tuck into a delicious assortment of puddings, while Harry has an empty space beside him and looks over at Seamus, who pointedly disregards him. He halts as Professor Umbridge, the former Undersecretary, rises smiling demurely. She's a small woman in a sugar-pink suit with matching accessories, and the twins are not persuaded as she beams at Dumbledore. Filch applauds enthusiastically. Harry walks into the Gryffindor common room, and everyone turns to look at him, while Ron glowers around the common room then follows Harry upstairs.

A waiting room is trotted into by the huge dog, and a man is turned into, then Harry runs in after him. Along the platform crowded with Hogwarts' students and their families, Harry walks, seeing Voldemort's tall, gaunt figure facing him. Voldemort's neck is twisted and flexed by the Dark Lord. In a corner of the carriage, Harry sits on the train, shifting uneasily and twisting his neck, while Hermione sits beside him and glances at Ron. The train is emerged from by them as Draco Malfoy struts along the platform. Harry is held back by Ron, but Ron is shaken off by Harry. Outside the station, four girls are sat in a horseless carriage, one of them being Cho, a pretty Oriental girl who smiles at Harry. Away is pulled by the carriage, and after it stares Harry. As another carriage is waited for by them, Neville joins them, carrying a cactus. A strange creature is seen by Harry when he turns; it has a head like a horse and its long leathery neck stretches. The animal is inspected more closely by Harry, puzzled. In the carriage behind it, a girl with long blond hair sits reading a magazine upside down. Climbing in is done by them all, and as they all look confused, shifting uncomfortably is done by Hermione. In the great hall, a luscious assortment of puddings is tucked into by Luna and the other students, while beside Harry, an empty space is had, and at Seamus, who pointedly ignores him, he looks over. Stopping is done as Professor Umbridge, the former Undersecretary, rises smiling primly. In a sugar-pink suit with matching accessories, she's a small woman, and the twins are not convinced as she beams at Dumbledore. Enthusiastic applause is given by Filch. Into the Gryffindor common room, Harry walks, and to look at him, everyone turns, while around the common room, a glare is given by Ron, then upstairs, Harry is followed by him.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The pair step into a corridor lined with shiny black tiles and see Fudge talking to Lucius Malfoy. Harry nods nervously at the jurors before approaching Fudge, as Dumbledore addresses them. Fudge raises his hand, and others follow, including Mrs. Figg and Amelia Bones. Harry jumps, but Dumbledore is gone. At Kings Cross Station, Moody and Nymphadora Tonks guide Harry and the Weasleys across a footbridge; a large black dog hesitates beside Harry before transforming into a man. Harry follows him and hands Sirius a group photo of 20 people, including his parents. On the platform crowded with Hogwarts students, Harry imagines Voldemort's tall, gaunt figure facing him. On the train, Harry shifts uneasily while Hermione sits beside him. As evening falls, the Hogwarts Express speeds along the coast. They disembark as Draco Malfoy walks by. Ron tries to hold Harry back, but he shakes him off. Outside, four girls sit in a horseless carriage, including Cho, who smiles at Harry. Neville joins them, carrying a cactus, as Harry spots a creature with a horse-like head behind him. A girl with long blond hair reads a magazine upside down in the next carriage. In the great hall, Luna and others enjoy puddings while Harry sits beside an empty space, ignored by Seamus. Professor Umbridge, in a sugar-pink suit, rises with a prim smile as Filch applauds. Harry enters the Gryffindor common room, everyone watching him, as Ron follows him upstairs.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: They step into a corridor with shiny black tiles and see Fudge speaking to Lucius Malfoy outside the courtroom. Nervous, Harry nods as jurors exchange glances and Dumbledore addresses them. Fudge raises his hand with a sickly smile, others follow, including Mrs. Figg, and Harry jumps to his feet, but Dumbledore is gone. At Kings Cross Station, Moody and Tonks guide Harry and the Weasleys across a footbridge, while a black dog turns into a man; Harry follows. In a photo, Harry's parents stand by Sirius. On the platform, Voldemort faces Harry, who uncomfortably shifts on the train with Hermione and Ron. As evening falls, the Hogwarts Express travels, and they exit as Draco Malfoy struts by. Ron restrains Harry, who shakes him off. Outside, Cho smiles at Harry from a carriage that leaves; Neville joins them with a cactus. Harry notices a horse-like creature and inspects it. A girl with blonde hair reads a magazine upside down in a carriage. In the great hall, Luna and others enjoy puddings; Harry, with an empty space beside him, is ignored by Seamus. Professor Umbridge, in a pink suit, smiles at Dumbledore, as Filch applauds. In the Gryffindor common room, Ron follows Harry upstairs as everyone stares.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
The two of them step out into the corridor, where both the walls and the floor are beautifully lined with gleaming, shiny black tiles that reflect the light with a polished sheen. They notice Fudge deep in conversation with Lucius Malfoy just outside the courtroom. Harry, feeling a wave of nervousness, nods awkwardly as the members of the jury exchange meaningful glances with one another. He cautiously approaches Fudge while Dumbledore lets out a resigned sigh and begins to address the gathered members of the jury. Some jurors murmur softly among themselves as Fudge raises his hand in a commanding gesture. With a sickly, almost forced smile, the Undersecretary raises her hand as well, and a few others quickly follow suit. Many more jurors gradually raise their hands in agreement; Mrs. Figg does the same before making a motion to scratch her ear, and Amelia Bones also raises her hand in support. Harry suddenly jumps to his feet with a sense of urgency, but he realizes that Dumbledore has already left. 

At Kings Cross Station, Moody and Nymphadora Tonks guide Harry along with the Weasley family across a bustling footbridge, while a large black dog hesitates momentarily at Harry's side. The enormous dog then trots swiftly into a quiet waiting room and astonishingly transforms into a man, prompting Harry to quickly run in after him. In a group photograph featuring 20 people, Harry's parents are seen standing proudly beside Sirius, and Harry kindly hands the photograph back to Sirius with a sense of nostalgia. Harry makes his way along the platform, which is crowded with Hogwarts' students and their families, and suddenly sees the tall, gaunt figure of Voldemort facing him. The Dark Lord ominously twists and flexes his neck. On the train, Harry finds a corner of the carriage to sit in, where he shifts uneasily and nervously twists his neck, while Hermione sits beside him, casting a glance at Ron. As evening descends, the Hogwarts Express races along the coastline, with a plume of white smoke streaming elegantly from its funnel. The majestic Hogwarts School is nestled beside a river that flows down to the sea. They disembark from the train just as Draco Malfoy struts arrogantly along the platform. Ron attempts to hold Harry back, but Harry firmly shakes Ron off. Outside the station, four girls are already seated in a horseless carriage, one of whom is Cho, a pretty Oriental girl who offers Harry a friendly smile. The carriage pulls away slowly, and Harry continues to stare after it with a longing expression. As they wait patiently for another carriage, Neville joins them, carrying a peculiar cactus. Harry turns his head and sees a strange creature standing behind him; it has a head resembling that of a horse and stretches its lengthy, leathery neck. Puzzled, Harry inspects the strange animal more closely. In the carriage behind it, a girl with long, flowing blond hair sits engrossed in reading a magazine, which she's holding upside down. They all climb into the carriage, and Hermione shifts uncomfortably as everyone looks confused. In the grand great hall, Luna and the other students eagerly tuck into a luscious assortment of puddings, while Harry finds an empty space beside him and looks over at Seamus, who is pointedly ignoring him. He pauses as Professor Umbridge, the former Undersecretary, rises with a prim smile. She's a small woman dressed in a sugar-pink suit, complete with matching accessories, and the twins are noticeably unconvinced as she beams confidently at Dumbledore. Filch applauds with enthusiastic fervor. Harry walks into the Gryffindor common room, and everyone turns to look at him with curiosity, while Ron glares around the room protectively and then follows Harry upstairs.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
The pair of them step out into the long corridor, a space where both the towering walls and the sleek floor are lavishly adorned with gleaming, shiny black tiles that beautifully reflect the ambient light with a polished sheen. As they make their way forward, they observe Fudge deeply engrossed in a conversation with Lucius Malfoy, positioned just outside the imposing courtroom. Harry, feeling a sudden wave of nervousness wash over him, nods awkwardly as the members of the jury exchange meaningful, knowing glances with one another. With careful steps, he cautiously approaches Fudge, while Dumbledore lets out a resigned sigh, already beginning to address the assembly of jury members gathered there. Some jurors softly murmur among themselves as Fudge brings his hand up, making a commanding gesture. With a sickly, almost forced smile on her face, the Undersecretary raises her hand as well, and a few others quickly follow suit. Gradually, many more jurors raise their hands, indicating their agreement; Mrs. Figg does the same, making a brief motion to scratch her ear, and Amelia Bones also raises her hand in support. Harry suddenly jumps to his feet with a sense of urgency surging through him, but he soon realizes, albeit too late, that Dumbledore has already left.

Meanwhile, at Kings Cross Station, Moody and Nymphadora Tonks skillfully guide Harry, along with the entire Weasley family, across a bustling footbridge, while a large black dog hesitates momentarily at Harry's side, seeming uncertain. The enormous dog then trots swiftly into a quiet waiting room, where it astonishingly transforms into a man, prompting Harry to quickly run in after him with curiosity. In a nostalgic group photograph featuring 20 people, Harry's parents are seen standing proudly beside Sirius, and Harry kindly hands the photograph back to Sirius, overwhelmed by a sense of nostalgia. As Harry makes his way along the platform, which is crowded with Hogwarts' students and their families, he suddenly sees the tall, gaunt figure of Voldemort ominously facing him. The Dark Lord ominously twists and flexes his neck with a menacing demeanor. On the train, Harry discovers a corner of the carriage to sit in, where he shifts uneasily and nervously twists his neck, while Hermione sits beside him, casting a meaningful glance at Ron. As the evening descends, the Hogwarts Express races elegantly along the coastline, with a plume of white smoke streaming elegantly from its funnel. The majestic Hogwarts School is nestled beside a winding river that flows gracefully down to the sea. They finally disembark from the train just as Draco Malfoy struts arrogantly along the platform. Ron attempts to hold Harry back, but Harry firmly shakes Ron off, determined. Outside the bustling station, four girls are already seated in a horseless carriage, one among them being Cho, a pretty Oriental girl who offers Harry a friendly, inviting smile. The carriage pulls away slowly, and Harry continues to stare after it with a longing expression, filled with wistfulness. As they wait patiently for another carriage to arrive, Neville joins them, carefully carrying a peculiar cactus in his hands. Harry turns his head and sees a strange creature standing behind him; it has a head resembling that of a horse and stretches its lengthy, leathery neck. Puzzled, Harry inspects the strange animal more closely, curious about its nature. In the carriage behind it, a girl with long, flowing blond hair sits engrossed in reading a magazine, which she intriguingly holds upside down. They all climb into the waiting carriage, and Hermione shifts uncomfortably as everyone looks on, confused by the situation. In the grand, great hall, Luna and the other students eagerly tuck into a luscious assortment of various puddings, while Harry finds an empty space beside him and looks over at Seamus, who is pointedly ignoring him, avoiding any interaction. He pauses as Professor Umbridge, previously the Undersecretary, rises with a prim, controlled smile. She's a small woman dressed in a sugar-pink suit, complete with matching accessories, and the twins are noticeably unconvinced as she beams confidently at Dumbledore, trying to project authority. Filch applauds with enthusiastic, fervent energy. As Harry walks into the Gryffindor common room, everyone turns to look at him with curiosity, their eyes full of questions, while Ron glares protectively around the room and then follows Harry upstairs, unwilling to leave his friend alone.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As they step out into the corridor, Harry and his companion take in the surroundings of shiny black tiles covering both the walls and the floor. Their eyes catch sight of Fudge engaged in conversation with Lucius Malfoy just outside the courtroom. Harry nods nervously, feeling the weight of the jurors' exchanged glances upon him. With some hesitation, he moves towards Fudge, while Dumbledore lets out a sigh and begins to address the members of the jury. Conversations among the jurors begin to murmur quietly, but they are interrupted as Fudge raises his hand authoritatively. Following his lead, the Undersecretary, with a sickly smile, lifts her hand into the air, prompting others to do the same. Several more jurors then raise their hands in succession; among them, Mrs. Figg raises hers, only to momentarily bring it down to scratch her ear, and Amelia Bones joins in by raising hers as well. In an abrupt motion, Harry jumps to his feet, but he quickly realizes that Dumbledore has already left the scene. This realization transitions them to Kings Cross Station, where Moody and Nymphadora Tonks guide Harry and the Weasley family across a footbridge. A large black dog hesitates momentarily beside Harry before trotting into a waiting room, where it transforms into a man. Without delay, Harry dashes in after the man. Inside, Harry sees a group photograph of 20 people in which his parents stand beside Sirius, who is also present. Thoughtfully, Harry returns the photograph to Sirius. Walking along the platform, bustling with Hogwarts' students and their families, he unexpectedly encounters the tall, gaunt figure of Voldemort facing him. The Dark Lord, without a word, twists and flexes his neck in a menacing manner. Once aboard the train, Harry finds a seat in a corner of the carriage, where he fidgets uneasily and mimics the twisting motion of his neck, while next to him, Hermione sits and shoots a quick glance at Ron. As evening descends, the Hogwarts Express races along the coastal line, its funnel emitting a continuous plume of white smoke. In the near distance, Hogwarts School is visible beside a river winding its way to the sea. As they disembark from the train, Draco Malfoy walks with an air of arrogance along the platform. Ron attempts to hold Harry back, but Harry resolutely shakes him off. Outside the station, four girls sit comfortably in a horseless carriage; among them is Cho, a pretty Oriental girl who offers Harry a warm smile as the carriage begins to pull away, leaving Harry gazing wistfully after it. While waiting for another carriage, Neville joins their group, holding a cactus securely in his hands. At that moment, Harry turns and notices a peculiar creature standing behind him, exhibiting a head resembling a horse and stretching its long leathery neck. Intrigued, Harry leans in closer to scrutinize the animal. In the next carriage behind them, a girl with long blond hair sits engrossed in a magazine, held upside down for reasons unknown. They all climb into a carriage, and Hermione, shifting awkwardly, observes the confused expressions around her. In the great hall, Luna and the other students indulge in a sumptuous array of puddings, while Harry finds himself sitting next to an empty space, casting a glance over at Seamus, who deliberately avoids making eye contact. His attention is diverted as Professor Umbridge, formerly an Undersecretary, stands with a prim smile. Her appearance is marked by a small stature and a sugar-pink suit adorned with matching accessories, which fails to convince the twins as she directs a beaming smile toward Dumbledore. Despite the mixed reactions, Filch offers his applause with great enthusiasm. Later, Harry makes his way into the Gryffindor common room, where the atmosphere shifts as everyone turns their gaze upon him. Ron, making a quick survey of the room with a glare, promptly follows Harry up the stairs, maintaining a steady pace behind him.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
The two of them step into a corridor lined with shiny black tiles and notice Fudge conversing with Lucius Malfoy outside the courtroom. Harry nervously nods as jurors exchange glances, then approaches Fudge while Dumbledore addresses the jury. As murmurs spread, Fudge and the Undersecretary signal for votes, and many jurors, including Mrs. Figg and Amelia Bones, raise their hands. Harry stands up abruptly but finds Dumbledore has already left.

At Kings Cross Station, Moody and Nymphadora Tonks guide Harry and the Weasley family across a footbridge, accompanied by a large black dog that later transforms into a man in a waiting room, prompting Harry to follow. In a group photo, Harry's parents stand beside Sirius, to whom Harry returns the photograph. Walking along the crowded platform with Hogwarts students and their families, Harry envisions the tall, gaunt figure of Voldemort, who flexes his neck. On the train, Harry sits restlessly while Hermione, beside him, glances at Ron.

As evening falls, the Hogwarts Express speeds along the coast, leaving a trail of white smoke, while Hogwarts stands by a river. Emerging from the train, Harry encounters Draco Malfoy strutting along the platform. Ron attempts to restrain Harry, but he shakes Ron off. Outside, four girls, including Cho, smile at Harry as their horseless carriage departs, leaving Harry watching. Neville joins them with a cactus as Harry notices a strange horse-like creature behind him, prompting him to inspect it curiously. In a carriage behind, a girl with long blond hair reads a magazine upside down. They all climb into the carriage, exchanging confused looks as Hermione shifts uncomfortably.

In the great hall, Luna and other students enjoy an assortment of puddings, while an isolated Harry looks over at Seamus, who ignores him. Professor Umbridge, in a sugar-pink suit, rises with a prim smile, greeting Dumbledore as the twins remain unconvinced and Filch applauds. In the Gryffindor common room, everyone turns to Harry as Ron follows him upstairs, glaring around.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The two of them step out into a corridor, the walls and floor lined with shiny black tiles reminiscent of obsidian, giving the hallway an imposing and foreboding atmosphere. They see Fudge, the Minister for Magic during a tumultuous time of rising dark forces, talking to Lucius Malfoy, known for his influential role in the wizarding world and strong ties to dark magic, outside the courtroom. Harry nods nervously as the jurors, tasked with the daunting decision that could change his future, exchange glances. He approaches Fudge while Dumbledore, the revered headmaster of Hogwarts and a prominent figure in magical history, sighs and addresses the members of the jury. Some jurors murmur to each other as Fudge raises his hand, signaling the weight of his authority in the courtroom. With a sickly smile, the Undersecretary, known for her ambition and strict adherence to the rules, raises hers, and others follow suit in a wave of compliance. Many more jurors raise their hands; Mrs. Figg, a Squib who provided crucial testimony for Harry, raises hers, then makes to scratch her ear, and Amelia Bones, respected for her integrity within the Ministry, raises her hand. Harry jumps to his feet, but Dumbledore has gone, always moving with a quiet, deliberate grace. At Kings Cross Station, the bustling hub where the magical and non-magical worlds intersect, Moody and Nymphadora Tonks, both skilled Aurors, lead Harry and the Weasley family across a footbridge, while a large black dog, revealed to be Sirius Black, Harry’s godfather in his Animagus form, hesitates beside Harry. The huge dog trots into a waiting room and turns into a man, and Harry runs in after him, seeking reassurance and guidance. In a group photograph of 20 people, taken during happier times, Harry's parents stand beside Sirius, showing a glimpse of the past before the dark times descended, and Harry hands the photograph back to Sirius. Harry walks along the platform crowded with Hogwarts' students and their families, seeing the tall, gaunt figure of Voldemort, the most feared dark wizard, facing him in a chilling vision. The Dark Lord twists and flexes his neck, exuding a menacing presence. On the train, Harry sits in a corner of the carriage, shifting uneasily and twisting his neck as he reflects on his terrifying vision, while Hermione, known for her intellect and loyalty, sits beside him and glances at Ron, her long-time friend. As evening falls, the Hogwarts Express speeds along the coast, a plume of white smoke streaming from the funnel, marking the train's iconic journey to the school of witchcraft and wizardry. Hogwarts School, an ancient institution known for its magical education, sits beside a river running down to the sea. They emerge from the train as Draco Malfoy, heir to a long line of influential wizards, struts along the platform with his usual air of superiority. Ron, ever protective of Harry, holds Harry back, but Harry shakes Ron off, determined to confront whatever lies ahead. Outside the station, four girls sit in a horseless carriage drawn by Thestrals, magical creatures visible only to those who have witnessed death, one of them being Cho, a pretty Oriental girl who smiles at Harry, sparking the complexities of young love. The carriage pulls away, and Harry stares after it, lost in thought. As they wait for another carriage, Neville joins them, carrying a cactus known as Mimbulus Mimbletonia, prized for its unique defensive properties. Harry turns and sees a strange creature behind him; it has a head like a horse and stretches its long leathery neck, a Thestral, symbolizing his growing awareness of the realities of life and death. Puzzled, Harry inspects the animal more closely. In the carriage behind it, a girl with long blond hair, Luna Lovegood, known for her eccentricities and insight, sits reading a magazine upside down, a testament to her unique perspective. They all climb in, and Hermione shifts uncomfortably as they all look confused, adjusting to the strange sights and sounds of their magical world. In the great hall, Luna and the other students tuck into a luscious assortment of puddings, while Harry has an empty space beside him and looks over at Seamus, who pointedly ignores him due to lingering tensions. He stops as Professor Umbridge, the former Undersecretary notorious for her draconian methods, rises smiling primly. She's a small woman in a sugar-pink suit with matching accessories, projecting an air of forced sweetness, and the twins, Fred and George Weasley, known for their mischief and entrepreneurship, are not convinced as she beams at Dumbledore, masking her true intentions. Filch, the castle caretaker infamous for his dislike of students, applauds enthusiastically. Harry walks into the Gryffindor common room, the heart of student life for his house, and everyone turns to look at him, aware of his growing reputation and the burdens he carries, while Ron glares around the common room then follows Harry upstairs, always standing by his best friend.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: The two of them step out into a corridor the walls and floor lined with shiny black tiles. They see Fudge talking to Lucius Malfoy outside the courtroom. Harry nods nervously as the jurors exchange glances. He approaches Fudge while Dumbledore sighs and addresses the members of the jury. Some jurors murmur to each other as Fudge raises his hand. With a sickly smile the Undersecretary raises hers and others follow suit. Many more jurors raise their hands. Mrs Figg raises hers then makes to scratch her ear and Amelia Bones raises her hand. Harry jumps to his feet but Dumbledore has gone. At Kings Cross Station Moody and Nymphadora Tonks lead Harry and the Weasley family across a footbridge while a large black dog hesitates beside Harry. The huge dog trots into a waiting room and turns into a man and Harry runs in after him. In a group photograph of 20 people Harry's parents stand beside Sirius and Harry hands the photograph back to Sirius. Harry walks along the platform crowded with Hogwarts' students and their families seeing the tall gaunt figure of Voldemort facing him. The Dark Lord twists and flexes his neck. On the train Harry sits in a corner of the carriage shifting uneasily and twisting his neck while Hermione sits beside him and glances at Ron. As evening falls the Hogwarts Express speeds along the coast. a plume of white smoke streaming from the funnel. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Hogwarts School sits beside a river running down to the sea. They emerge from the train as Draco Malfoy struts along the platform. Ron holds Harry back but Harry shakes Ron off. Outside the station four girls sit in a horseless carriage one of them being Cho a pretty Oriental girl who smiles at Harry. The carriage pulls away and Harry stares after it. As they wait for another carriage Neville joins them carrying a cactus. Harry turns and sees a strange creature behind him. it has a head like a horse and stretches its long leathery neck. Puzzled Harry inspects the animal more closely. In the carriage behind it a girl with long blond hair sits reading a magazine upside down. They all climb in and Hermione shifts uncomfortably as they all look confused. In the great hall Luna and the other students tuck into a luscious assortment of puddings while Harry has an empty space beside him and looks over at Seamus who pointedly ignores him. He stops as Professor Umbridge the former Undersecretary rises smiling primly. She is a small woman in a sugarpink suit with matching accessories and the twins are not convinced as she beams at Dumbledore. Filch applauds enthusiastically. Harry walks into the Gryffindor common room and everyone turns to look at him while Ron glares around the common room. then follows Harry upstairs.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: The two of them step out into a corridor the walls and floor lined with shiny black tiles. They see Fudge talking to Lucius Malfoy outside the courtroom. Harry nods nervously as the jurors exchange glances. He approaches Fudge while Dumbledore sighs and addresses the members of the jury. Some jurors murmur to each other as Fudge raises his hand. With a sickly smile the Undersecretary raises hers and others follow suit. Many more jurors raise their hands. Mrs Figg raises hers then makes to scratch her ear and Amelia Bones raises her hand. Harry jumps to his feet but Dumbledore has gone. At Kings Cross Station Moody and Nymphadora Tonks lead Harry and the Weasley family across a footbridge while a large black dog hesitates beside Harry. The huge dog trots into a waiting room and turns into a man and Harry runs in after him. In a group photograph of 20 people Harry's parents stand beside Sirius and Harry hands the photograph back to Sirius. Harry walks along the platform crowded with Hogwarts' students and their families seeing the tall gaunt figure of Voldemort facing him. The Dark Lord twists and flexes his neck. On the train Harry sits in a corner of the carriage shifting uneasily and twisting his neck while Hermione sits beside him and glances at Ron. As evening falls the Hogwarts Express speeds along the coast. a plume of white smoke streaming from the funnel. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The penguins amble into a garden, the paths and hedges adorned with glossy red pebbles. They spot Biscuit chatting with Marcus Umbridge outside the bakery. Billy grins anxiously as the cooks swap smiles. He skips over to Biscuit while Victoria yawns and sings to the members of the choir. Some of the cooks giggle to one another as Biscuit lifts his foot. With a curious frown, the Assistant bends hers, and others mimic. Countless more cooks bend their elbows; Mrs. Twig bends hers, then leans to pat her nose, and Oliver Stones bends his foot. Billy hops to his elbows, but Victoria has vanished. At Lunar Harbor, Captain and Minnie Whisper steer Billy and the Panda family over a ladder, while a tiny white rabbit pauses beside Billy. The towering rabbit hops into a garden shed and morphs into a woman, and Billy skips in behind her. In a collection of 20 paintings, Billy's grandparents pose beside Alfred, and Billy returns the painting to Alfred. Billy skips along the cliff lined with Mermaid’s villagers and their friends, seeing the short, bright silhouette of Gingermint facing him. The Pale Sorcerer swivels and stretches his arms. On the bus, Billy perches in a nook of the chariot, resting easily and curling his elbows, while Francesca cuddles beside him and peers at George. As twilight casts, the Mermaid's Shuttle races along the mountains, a drizzle of green mist twirling from the chimney. Mermaid's Castle perches beside a mountain cascading down to the ocean. They stroll from the bus as Juno Umbridge prances along the cliff. George holds Billy close, but Billy nudges George away. Outside the harbor, three turtles float in a magic gondola, one of them being Molly, a charming Southern turtle who waves at Billy. The gondola drifts away, and Billy gazes after it. As they linger for another cart, Oliver joins them, juggling a watermelon. Billy swivels and spots an odd sculpture behind him; it has a face like a crow and straightens its broad scaly wings. Curious, Billy examines the sculpture more intently. In the cart behind it, a boy with short curly fur stands holding a map upside down. They all crawl in, and Francesca sighs awkwardly as they all feel bewildered. In the grand meadow, Liam and the other villagers munch on a creamy selection of pastas, while Billy has an empty chair beside him and peers over at Rocco, who determinedly ignores him. He halts as Miss Porridge, the retired Assistant, rises smirking slyly. She’s a tall lady in a lemon-gray dress with matching shoes, and the triplets are not amused as she grins at Victoria. Ivan claps wildly. Billy skips into the Lion's den, and everyone swivels to glance at him, while George frowns around the den then skips after Billy sideways.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Harry and Dumbledore leave a corridor with shiny black tiles and approach a courtroom where they find Fudge and Lucius Malfoy. Jurors exchange glances as Fudge and the Undersecretary raise their hands, and many others follow, including Mrs. Figg and Amelia Bones. Dumbledore disappears, leaving Harry jumping to his feet. At Kings Cross Station, Harry, along with Moody, Tonks, and the Weasleys, is joined by a large black dog that transforms into a man, Sirius, in a waiting room. Harry hands Sirius a photograph of his parents with Sirius. At Hogwarts, Harry is haunted by visions of Voldemort as he navigates a crowded platform and takes the train with Ron and Hermione. Draco Malfoy struts nearby, and Cho, a pretty girl, smiles at Harry. Harry encounters a strange horse-like creature as they wait for a carriage, joined by Neville with a cactus, and a girl with long blond hair reading upside down. In the great hall, students indulge in desserts while Harry notices Seamus ignoring him. Professor Umbridge, in a pink suit, rises to speak, but the twins remain skeptical as Filch applauds. In the Gryffindor common room, Harry attracts attention, and Ron follows him upstairs.
